rename.from: dynamic env is an empty project in production when using `kit.config.env.dir`
rename.to: dynamic env is an empty project in production when using `config.kit.env.dir`

rename.from: dynamic env is an empty project in production when using `config.kit.env.dir`
rename.to: dynamic env is an empty object in production when using `config.kit.env.dir`

body: Based on my testing, this should be fixed with #6179. The problem isn't even the new `config.kit.env.dir` option, it's that (1) we weren't initializing the variables correctly in `prerendering` and (2) something something, complicated initialization sequences. Either way, the repro works fine when I point it at that branch.
Closing this then since that PR has been merged. Note that it hasn't been released yet
that reproduction looks to be on the latest version and any changes from a week ago have certainly been released by now, so I'd expect it to work

I can't decide if this is intended behavior or not. On one hand, the dynamic env is populated by your adapter at runtime -- in this case, your "adapter" is SvelteKit...? 

@Rich-Harris Do you think `preview` should respect `config.kit.env.dir`? I think my vote would be yes, but I want your blessing before doing anything with it.
Just a heads up that this issue can also be reproduced when using `adapter-node` then running `npm run build && node build/index.js`

> Just a heads up that this issue can also be reproduced when using `adapter-node` then running `npm run build && node build/index.js`

This is _definitely_ intended behavior.

> This is definitely intended behavior.

I had falsely assumed that `$env/dynamic` would automatically inject `.env` files (a la dotenv), despite the docs stating otherwise.

Please feel free to close this issue.

> > This is definitely intended behavior.
> 
> I had falsely assumed that `$env/dynamic` would automatically inject `.env` files (a la dotenv), despite the docs stating otherwise.
> 
> Please feel free to close this issue.

It does in `dev`, obviously, but prod depends on the adapter. I'll wait to close until we hear from @Rich-Harris on whether the `preview` "adapter" should read `.env` files.

issue.title: [docs] Highlight different `$env/dynamic` behavior between `dev` and `prod`
issue.body:
It wasn't immediately clear to me, https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/6204, that `$env/dynamic` might be loaded differently depending on `dev`/`prod`. Because `$env/dynamic` included `.env` during `dev`, I erroneously assumed it would do the same during `prod` (a la dotenv) when using `adapter-node`.

The second sentence could be clearer but I don't know enough about the topic to make it so.

- [x] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [ ] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [ ] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [ ] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. All changesets should be `patch` until SvelteKit 1.0
